title: Drawing, Design for a ceiling in a church or a chapel, 1700–1750
title_raw: Design for a ceiling in a church or a chapel
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and brown and black washes on off-white laid paper, laid down
markings: Lower right: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration [Lugt 457c]
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Shows Christ in glory flanked by two figures (Mary and John) above. Below, figures appear to be raised from the dead. Subject could possibly be a Last Judgment, or The Descent into Hell"

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a ceiling in a church or a chapel, 1700–1750. Pen and black ink, brush and brown and black washes on off-white laid paper, laid down. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1694
